page.title: 03A new Ropley family
page.content: We moved into Ropley a year ago from the North London suburb of South Ruislip.Dad's job had moved him to Hampshire and we wanted to live in the country rather then in a town.The move to Ropley meant that we could have a big house that wasn't exactly the same as all the other houses because although people here think that houses are expensive in Ropley they aren't compared to London.We thought the house we found was just right because it is just opposite the school and near the church and the village shop. Mum hasn't got a car so the village shop keeps us in food until Saturdays when we go and do our main shopping. There are also clubs and societies that interested all the family. I really like living here,I quickly made lots of friends,and so did the rest of the family.
